channel.title: Scanning for Letters,
channel.description: Hello, here is what I want to do, I want to be able to input letters into my program when I run it and get an answer, I know how to get numbers to work, but not letters, what would be the correct scanner statement for scanning for a string? And how would I let it type in my answer? You can't switch on a type of string so this seems very hard, Any Help?

item.title: Scanning for Letters,

item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

eczema3:

evidently not

Apparently you didn’t read the above, my problem had been FIXED before you ever posted.

item.title: Scanning for Letters,
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:8, topic:416551”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=518449.msg3767787#msg3767787 date=1317403050]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=518449.msg3767763#msg3767763 date=1317401466]

The first 3 pages of any book, after the basics of Java have been covered, will teach you how to do this.

I have read many books and tutorials, but you cannot switch on a type of string, so I have a problem, how will I make the string have a right answer and wrong answer? I’ve tried an if-else statement.
[/quote]You can now! Java 7 has been out for weeks now, get with the times bro

Wait you mean switch on the type string? But Eclipse says I can’t… and I have Java 7.
[/quote]Clearly Eclipse is A: Not configured to use java7 standards, or B: Doesn’t support it. I’d say A is the one that makes most sense.

http://blog.teamextension.com/java-7-on-eclipse-indigo-479[/quote]
Thanks bro your the only one who actually got it right

Read full topic

I have read many books and tutorials, but you cannot switch on a type of string, so I have a problem, how will I make the string have a right answer and wrong answer? I’ve tried an if-else statement.
[/quote]You can now! Java 7 has been out for weeks now, get with the times bro

Wait you mean switch on the type string? But Eclipse says I can’t… and I have Java 7.[/quote]Clearly Eclipse is A: Not configured to use java7 standards, or B: Doesn’t support it. I’d say A is the one that makes most sense.

http://blog.teamextension.com/java-7-on-eclipse-indigo-479
